page_analysis.text_content:
Step 4: Finalize the determination of which segments are closed and which are open, total the linear feet in each
category, and compare the totals.

For the porch in Fig 5, the summary is as follows:

Closed

Segment Feet
A
3'
B
8'
C
10'
E
14'

35'

Open

Segment Feet
D
7'
F
24'
G
4'

35'

Conclusion: The perimeter of the porch in Fig 5 is 50% open and so the porch would NOT count toward gross floor area

Note: If a porch floor is more than 30" above
grade, the porch sides may need to be 36" high for
safety reasons. This may cause the porch facade
to be considered closed. Possible solutions to make
sure the porch sides are considered open are
illustrated to the right:

• Railings (ballisters) instead of solid half walls.
• A single safety rail above lower, solid half walls.

10

visual_elements.description: A top-down view of a porch structure, showing various segments labeled A through G with their respective lengths. Segments A, B, C, E are shaded dark gray, indicating 'Closed segments'. Segments D, F, G are shaded light gray, indicating 'Open segments'. Dimensions are provided for each segment. The overall dimensions of the porch are also indicated.
visual_elements.location: Top right and middle of the page

visual_elements.description: A legend for the porch diagram, showing a dark gray square labeled 'Closed segments' and a light gray square labeled 'Open segments'.
visual_elements.location: Top right, above the porch diagram

visual_elements.description: A two-column table summarizing the 'Closed' segments and their lengths, and another two-column table summarizing the 'Open' segments and their lengths. Both tables show a total of 35' at the bottom.

Two side-by-side cross-sectional diagrams of porch railings. The left diagram shows a porch with vertical railings (ballisters) and a safety rail. The right diagram shows a porch with a lower solid half wall and a single safety rail above it. Both diagrams indicate a 'Porch flr' (porch floor) and 'Grade' (ground level). Dimensions of 30" from grade to porch floor and 36" from porch floor to safety rail are shown.

A large gray arrow pointing from the 'Note' box on the bottom left to the two cross-sectional diagrams on the bottom right, indicating that the diagrams illustrate the solutions mentioned in the note.

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum porch floor height above grade for safety considerations
Required porch side height for safety reasons

additional_notes: Page number '10' is present at the bottom left.
